text: thank you for the introduction so i'm

campbell which provides access to patent
data hosted in the cloud
so firstly just a little bit about the
institute
uh where i work
so i'm based at somewhere called embl

organization
based just south of cambridge here in
the uk we have a number of mission
statements the most important of which
is essentially delivering
biological data and services to all

we also strive to deliver

on all the data and services we make
available
we also
are home to a number of groups who are

sciences and these range from

is provide data for drug discovery at

information from the scientific
literature
capture these entities so these could be
drugs or small molecules
it could be the targets they interact
within the human body and we capture all

kimball database
we make this database publicly available
and then we and our users are then able
to build applications tools gain
insights essentially all aimed at
assisting drug discovery research and
advancement
and who uses our data
well we estimate somewhere in the region
about 10 000 organizations around the

use our data and over the last four to

it allows you to understand what your

so this is where shaw campbell comes in
so at the end of last year emble ebi
institute brian based acquired the shore
camera system and this was a leading
chemistry patent mining tool
developed by digital science which is
part of the macmillan group
and upon acquiring it we underwent the
process of uh turning this from a
commercial product into an open uh
product free for all and this transition
was a perfect fit both for us
in the kimball group and in embolde as
we wanted to give them access uh provide
access to patent data and for digital
science who no longer saw this product
as part of their future business plan
we rebranded it shaw campbell and then

resources
and this is where the challenge really
started for us
so at embled ebi we have access to a
large amount of computer resources
but the shaw came system was
developed written and optimized to run
on aws
so essentially the question would face
is should we migrate the system onto our
own embled ebi-controlled resources or
migrate within aws and there is a number
of considerations to take into account
uh when making this decision so it was a
live system continually updating with
many dependencies had a very complex
data processing pipeline under it there
was existing customers
and as a large user base as well and we
wanted to ensure there was no downtime
during the migration process we had a
very short time scale limited resources
fairly limited budget
um and at the time of carrying out this

manage this and run the system
in an aws environment
so when we
thought about all these uh various
considerations we came to the conclusion
that
essentially staying with aws was the
best way forward for this in this

and now the the shaw gamble system has
been migrated and is running in an aws

quick overview of the system
it's a user interface built on top of an
api
and in simplest form you can do a
keyword search against the literature
but you can also more powerfully uh do

and you can access it with the

but under the hood what are we using so
we're using many uh ec2 instances and
these are running within a virtual
private cloud
we're using elastic load balancer to
handle our incoming traffic on our ui
and api boxes in our data processing
pipeline we use sqs to handle messages

have a number of volumes
ebs volumes attached to all our
instances and make you also making use
of snapshots and pack-ups we use some of

for monitoring and iam for managing our
user accounts
and though we've had limited experience
we've been able to essentially
identify a number of benefits throughout

aws has provided us with the

build this in the system

so again just based on our limited

there's many white papers and best

if you are going to migrate a system uh
use the virtual private cloud to
architect it with
you might need to refresh some of your

and migrating from a sort of class key

to estimate how much you will be

for us in our particular situation we

and finally when we're not using

and finally on the recommendation just

maintenance windows which will be
occurring with various services
